intro: Cryptophoranthus kautskyi, commonly known as the Kautsky's cryptophoranthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, tubular flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its native habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
